description: Saudi club continue chase for Rangers forward, St Johnstone and Ross County line up new arrivals...
title: Scottish Gossip: Rangers, Celtic, St Johnstone, Ross County, Livingston, Sakala, Doig
title_page: Scottish Gossip: Rangers, Celtic, St Johnstone, Ross County, Livingston, Sakala, Doig - BBC Sport
maintext:
Published
2 August 2023
Saudi Arabian club Al-Fayha are to return with a fresh Â£3m bid for Fashion Sakala despite the Rangers striker rejecting their initial advances. (Daily Mail, print edition)
Jose Cifuentes is expected in Glasgow today as the Ecuador midfielder nears the completion of a four-year deal with Rangers. (Daily Record), external
Dundee are closing in on goalkeeper Trevor Carson after agreeing a six figure fee with St Mirren. (Daily Record), external
St Johnstone have agreed a two-year deal for versatile former Liverpool and Southampton defender Oludare Olufunwa. (Courier), external
Ross County are in the chase to land a loan move for Arsenal striker Nathan Butler-Oyedeji. (Press & Journal), external
Former Celtic striker Chris Sutton has warned Brendan Rodgers to think twice before rushing to replace Joe Hart as his number one goalkeeper. (Daily Record), external
"If I got sacked tomorrow then I'd be back on a building site trying to pay my mortgage," says Livingston boss David Martindale, who insists success is keeping the West Lothian club in the top flight. (Scottish Sun), external
Scotland Under-21 defender Josh Doig is in talks with Fulham after spending a year with Hellas Verona in Serie A. (Calciomercato via Daily Record, external)
Middlesbrough are considering a bid for Sunderland and Scotland striker Ross Stewart. (Football Insider), external
